text: Dynamic imine condensation is often run at temperature 50-90 °C with a mild acid catalyst. Concentration 0.08-0.25 M can improve crystallinity by slowing precipitation.
Mixed solvents such as dioxane/mesitylene can help solubilise aromatic precursors while enabling reversible bond formation. Temperature 60-110 °C is common for porous network formation.
High concentration above 0.30 M can lead to rapid nucleation and low crystallinity. A practical range is concentration 0.05-0.25 M when exploring new building blocks.
Stronger acids may accelerate reaction but can trap amorphous products; optimisation of catalyst and temperature is recommended for balancing yield and long-range order.
